text.p: South Australian wine maker Peter Lehmann Wines Ltd said on Friday it plans to expand its operation in the 1996/97 financial year.
"A new 2,000 square metre complex is to be erected on the eastern elevation to the existing winery complex at a capital cost of A$488,000," the company said in a statement.
The company said the new facility would satisfy its wood housing need to the year 2000.
Earlier on Thursday, Peter Lehmann reported a 39 percent jump in its net profit for the year to June 30, 1996 to A$1.81 million.
The company said it also planned to install an additional small stainless steel storage and refrigeration units at a total cost of A$545,000.
All capital expenditure would be financed through bank borrowings, Peter Lehmann said.
Peter Lehmann shares last traded at 95 cents on Thursday.
